text: Arthur Lanon Neville (December 17, 1937 â€“ July 22, 2019) was an American singer-songwriter and keyboardist. He was born in New Orleans, Louisiana. Neville was a part of The Neville Brothers. He was a founding member of The Meters. He also played with the spinoff group The Funky Meters. Neville performed with singers Labelle (on "Lady Marmalade"), Paul McCartney, Lee Dorsey, Robert Palmer, Dr. John and Professor Longhair. Neville died at the age of 81 on July 22, 2019 from a long-illness. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American soul singers Category:American R&B; singers Category:American funk musicians Category:American soul musicians Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American pianists Category:Singers from New Orleans Category:Musicians from New Orleans Category:Writers from New Orleans
title: Art Neville
